data.title: Lisa Kaplan and Brad Sherman
data.meta_description: The couple were to be married Sunday afternoon at the Calamigos Ranch in Malibu, Calif.
data.text:
Lisa Nicola Kaplan and Representative Brad James Sherman, Democrat of California, are to be married this afternoon. Rabbi Edward Feinstein will officiate at the Calamigos Ranch in Malibu, Calif., with Rabbi Mark S. Miller participating.

The bride, 34, is the deputy director of the office on global anti-Semitism in the Bureau of Democracy, Human Rights and Labor at the State Department. She graduated from Williams and received two masterâ€™s degrees, one in public policy from Harvard and one in international administration from the School for International Training in Brattleboro, Vt.

She is the daughter of Dr. Robert J. Kaplan of New York and the late Carol Weisberg. Her father is a forensic psychiatrist appointed by judges to do evaluations in divorce custody disputes. She is the stepdaughter of Peggy Jarrell Kaplan, a portrait photographer whose work is being shown at Ronald Feldman Fine Arts, a gallery in Manhattan.

The bridegroom, 52, was elected last month to his sixth term in the House of Representatives; he represents the San Fernando Valley area of Los Angeles. He graduated summa cum laude from the University of California, Los Angeles, and received his law degree magna cum laude from Harvard.

He is the son of Lane Sherman of Los Angeles and the late Maurice Sherman. His mother was his assistant campaign manager. His father was the senior vice president of the National Education Corporation, a company that owned vocational and correspondence schools around the country.
